title: Violent teacher banned after stomping on boy's foot and shoving pupil at school
text:

A violent primary school teacher was banned for life over classroom cruelty towards vulnerable children aged under seven.

Karen Owen stomped on a schoolboy's foot, shoved a pupil like “closing a car door” and screamed inches from another child’s face.

The 57-year-old was struck off the teaching register indefinitely over her volatile outbursts at St Michael’s C of E primary in Kings Lynn, Norfolk.

A misconduct hearing ruled she displayed “behaviours associated with violence against more than one extremely vulnerable pupil”.

Owen was in charge of a special unit at the school dealing with pupils with complex behavioural and emotional needs.

A witness told the Teaching Regulation Agency how Owen deliberately stood on a boy’s foot because he wouldn’t stop screaming.

She later confessed to the colleague: “I was silly yesterday and could have lost my job. He was screaming and I was stressed.”

(Image: Getty Images/Cultura RF)

Owen denied standing on the boy’s foot, insisting it was just “an accident”.

She told the hearing: “I did not do this deliberately and did not realise I was doing so until a Teaching Assistant told me I was doing so. I asked the child to check his foot, but he said he was fine.”

Owen was also found to have touched a pupil’s face while he ate, and shoved another youngster as he got up from the floor during “relaxation time”.

A witness said she "shoved him back down in the sort of motion you would use to close a car door".

On another occasion, a witness told how the teacher screamed in the face of the same boy, known as Pupil B.

They told the hearing, in Coventry, West Midlands, that Owen “suddenly stomped into the area and then either crouched down or got down onto her knees so she was eye level with Pupil B.

“Ms Owen placed her hands over Pupil B’s [hands], and screamed at him. This was basically screaming in his face due to proximity.”

Other colleagues at the school gave evidence to say that Owen had also screamed at other pupils.

Owen was ruled to have exposed Key Stage 1 pupils to harm between 2016 and 2018.

Panel chair Alison Walsh said: “The panel found that Mrs Owen displayed behaviours associated with violence against more than one extremely vulnerable pupil with complex needs.”

Owen “displayed no insight into the impact of her physical and emotional actions against particularly vulnerable pupils,” added Mrs Walsh.

The disciplinary hearing was also told that Owen, who did not attend the hearing, failed to complete important child protection paperwork.

She previously said she was under "unprecedented pressure" from a heavy workload and was "truly sorry" for poor record-keeping.

Owen was struck off the teaching register indefinitely for inappropriate physical contact and unacceptable professional conduct Signing off on the ban, civil servant Dawn Dandy said keeping Owen in the profession “puts at risk future pupils’ safety”.

She added: “I am particularly mindful of the finding of violence in this case and the impact that such a finding has on the reputation of the profession.”

Owen has 28 days to appeal the prohibition order, which is indefinite and cannot be reviewed.
description: Karen Owen, 57, also screamed inches from another child’s face at St Michael’s C of E primary in Kings Lynn, Norfolk, a hearing was told
